name: Acceptance criteria - What is the lot size?
Freq - Prior to start of Works
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Is the most current survey file what the team is working to and has the work area been set out for line and level?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Photos
Acceptance criteria - Where necessary, have batters been rounded and catch drains constructed to allow for potential surface runoff during the course of excavation?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Photos
Acceptance criteria - Has the area been cleared and grubbed in accordance with ITP-002?
Freq - Prior to start of Works
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Photos
Is the area in cut / fill / both?
If in cut proceed to step 2.0 and strike out section 3.0.
If in fill please strike out section 2.0 and proceed to section 3.0
If in both proceed to step 2.0 as well as section 3.0
Ref docs - MRH/00/P/0 0- PM/SPC/00 03 rev 3 page 53
Acceptance criteria - Has the material being excavated been inspected with category agreed upon by Superintendent? Tick category below:
Freq - Prior to start of Works
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test reports
Acceptance criteria - Has the stockpile location been approved by SGJV.
Freq - Prior to start of Works
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - SGJV approved stockpile plan
Acceptance criteria - Has the cut surface been trimmed to an even surface free from lose material?
○ Have surface levels been checked to avoid over excavation?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test reports/as- built survey
Acceptance criteria - Has lime demand testing been completed and submitted?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Has the prepared subgrade been lime stabilised as per the IFC design?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Photos/As-built report
Ref docs - IFC drawing MRH/A0/B0 0- CV/DWG/00 08
Acceptance criteria - Compaction Scale: minimum 3 tests per lot, or 1 test per 1000m2
○ Has the stabilised subgrade been adequately compacted achieving 100 SDD for subgrade.
○ Is the subgrade material within +/- 2% of the optimum moisture content.
○ Has a minimum 3% CBR been achieved?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Does the layer withstand test rolling without visible deformation or springing?
If ‘no’ please see below. If ‘yes’ please proceed.
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Identification of soft wet or unstable material
Acceptance criteria - What quantity of soft, wet, or unstable material is present?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Photos
Acceptance criteria - Has rectification process been submitted to SGJV for review. What was the rectification process used.
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Aconex Correspondence
Acceptance criteria - Has the material to be used as fill been approved for use?
Freq - Prior to start of Works
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Material Acceptance correspondence/Certificate
Acceptance criteria - Does the stripped surface to be filled withstand test rolling without visible deformation or springing?
If ‘no’ please see below. If ‘yes’ please proceed to item 3.2
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Identification of soft wet or unstable material (1)
Acceptance criteria - What quantity of soft, wet or unstable material is present?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Photos /Visual check
Acceptance criteria - What rectification process is to be undertaken
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Aconex Correspondence/Approval from SGJV
Acceptance criteria - Has adequate water been added to the stripped surface to ensure adhesion to the next layer?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Photos
Ref docs - IFC drawing MRH/A0/B0 0- CV/DWG/00 08
Acceptance criteria - Has fill been placed in maximum 300mm and minimum 100mm compacted layer thickness?
○ Rock in the fill should be less than 75 mm.
– Fill should be free of clay and free from organic.
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Photos
Acceptance criteria - Has the material maintained at optimum moisture content (within +/- 2% of optimum moisture), with additional water being added if required during compaction?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test Reports
Ref docs - IFC Dwgs MRH/A0/B/ 00- CV/DWG/00 40
Acceptance criteria - Has mix demand testing been completed and submitted?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Has the prepared subgrade been lime stabilised as per the IFC design?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Photos/As-built report
Ref docs - IFC drawing MRH/A0/B0 0- CV/DWG/00 08
Acceptance criteria - Compaction Scale: minimum 3 tests per lot, or 1 test per 1000m2
○ Has the stabilised subgrade been adequately compacted achieving 100% SDD for subgrade.
○ Is the subgrade material within +/- 2% of the optimum moisture content.
○ Has a minimum 3% CBR been achieved?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Does the layer withstand test rolling without visible deformation or springing?
If ‘no’ please see below. If ‘yes’ please proceed
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Identification of soft wet or unstable material (2)
Acceptance criteria - What quantity of soft, wet or unstable material is present?

Acceptance criteria - Has rectification process been submitted to SGJV for Review? What was the rectification process used?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Photos
Acceptance criteria - Has the pavement been constructed at the correct width and alignment as detailed in the construction drawings?
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Has the prepared subgrade been surveyed in accordance with and verifying specified requirements?
○ Is the subgrade within +/- 20mm of design surface.
